page.title: 05HARTPURY VILLAGE HALL
page.content: Despite the fact that the community is spread over a wide area, the Village Hall provides a centre for social activities. The original wooden building was opened by Mrs. Gordon Canning in 1901. In 1977 an extension in brick was constructed to accommodate toilets, kitchen, committee room and stage. In the future it is proposed to replace the original eastern wall with brick and build a storeroom on the north side. The Village Hall is administered by an elected, voluntary committee who raise funds by organising annual functions including Harvest Supper, Spring Supper Dance and Summer Fete. The'100 Club', an offshoot of the committee, was started principally to raise funds for Village Hall improvements through twice yearly draws and social evenings.
